concept.title: Navigation links
concept.shortdesc: To ease readers in navigating from one topic to another, each XHTML file generated by a DITA topic contains navigation links at the bottom.

dlentry.dd: Takes readers to the parent topic, which is the topic referenced by the closest topic in the containment hierarchy
Takes readers to the previous topic in the reading sequence
Takes readers to the next topic in the reading sequence
Takes readers to the place in the table of contents for the current topic in the reading sequence

conbody.p: The following screen capture illustrates how navigation links are displayed in the XHTML version of the specification:

image.alt: Screenshot fragment showing three labeled hyperlinks plus the sentence 'Return to main page' with 'main page' styled as a hyperlink (blue and underlined). The first three hyperlinks are labeled 'Parent topic', 'Previous topic', and 'Next topic', and each hyperlink text consists of a chapter/section number along with a topic title.

conbody.p: When readers hover over the navigation links, the short description of the DITA topic also is displayed.
